intro: Klainedoxa buesgenii, commonly known as the Buesgen's klainedoxa, is a rare and endemic plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
